snippet: Shohret Hoshur, a journalist who fled the Chinese authorities in Xinjiang, has continued to chronicle violence there for Radio Free Asia, based in Washington.
abstract: Saturday Profile of journalist Shohret Hoshur, who escaped China in 1994 after writing articles in Uighur language that angered authorities; he continues to report on events in Xinjiang Uighur Autonomous Region that China's government tries to keep secret through United States-funded news service Radio Free Asia and website; members of his family in China have been arrested and threatened, but he feels obligation to his sources, who pass information to him at great personal risk.
lead_paragraph: Shohret Hoshur, a journalist who fled the Chinese authorities in Xinjiang, has continued to chronicle violence there for Radio Free Asia, based in Washington.

headline.print_headline: Reporting From the U.S. on China’s Uighur Homeland
headline.main: A Voice From China’s Uighur Homeland, Reporting From the U.S.
